Author: Angelini, Giuseppe
Title: L' aggiornamento: suggestioni e problemi di una formula fortunata
Abstract Note: At the beginning of the Second Vatican Council, in particular in John XXIII’s aim, the urging practical reformation (preaching language, ecclesiastic discipline, pastoral forms in general) seemed not to touch its depositum fidei; the clear-cut distinction between truth forever and historical forms caused the success of the updating category. That separation progressively became as clear as abstract; truth is certainly beyond historical forms, nevertheless it cannot be determined but by them. The “anachronism” of pastoral ministry is not only the effect of deplorable inactivity, it is also and above all the consequence of unsolved theoretical problems, caused by modern cultural changings. The concrete story of the Council progressively underlines the delicate and even dangerous feature of the updating process; it threatens to legitimate the adjusting to the new culture. In particular Paul VI, in a 1965 address, already pointed out to that risk and he distinguished between a relevant and irrelevant sense of updating. His Distinction prepared the schematic confrontation between two Council hermeneutical trends by Benedict XVI. The difference between a deplorable adjusting and a necessary confrontation with the new culture may be made clear only on condition that we distinctively investigate two thought orders: a) the theoretic one about the necessary difference between culture and conscience which cannot remove their relationship; b) the historical practical one about the forms of contemporary culture and in particular about the growing distance which, in late modernity, appears between conscience and culture; it threatens to become a radical break. [ABSTRACT FROM AUTHOR]

Author: Brambilla, Franco Giulio
Title: La ricerca faticosa di una via per il concilio: Giovanni XXIII e Montini-Paolo VI
Abstract Note: The article reconstructs the crucial speeches of Card. Montini at the “beginning of the Council” (before the opening section and during the First Period) together with his various comments which above all accompanied the year 1962 – exactly fifty years ago – among which the pastoral Let’s Think Of The Council stands out for its high inspiration. By these ones it is possible to retrace Card. Montini’s “track” to that ecumenical assembly. The Cardinal of Milan felt the Council at its rising moment like “the Spirit’s event”. While calling up those thrilling and at the same time excited moments of the Church life, which stood out in Milan Archbishop Montini’s last speech on the 5<sup>th</sup> December in the Council hall, we can hardly feel the Spirit’s breeze passing through. The watermark of the research is the contribution of Carlo Colombo, Paul VI’s future theologian, to Montini’s preparation for the Council.
Short Title: La ricerca faticosa di una via per il concilio

Author: Rota, Giovanni
Title: Il Concilio Vaticano II e la Tradizione: i punti nodali di un dibattito
Abstract Note: The question of Tradition was one of the “high lights” which determined the whole development of the Second Vatican Council. To retrace the various components we followed an inquiry marked by three moments: in the first step we introduced the decisions taken by the Council of Trent in its Sacrosancta decree in opposition to the Sola Scriptura Lutheran one; in the second step we dealt about the editing story, the contents and the “cores” of the debate about the second chapter of Dei Verbum of the Second Vatican about the theme of Tradition; eventually we tried to discover what the terms of the problem and the ways towards a possible solution of its might be.
Short Title: Il Concilio Vaticano II e la Tradizione

Author: Seveso, Bruno
Title: Vaticano II. L’indole pastorale
Abstract Note: The “pastoral” connotation, authoritatively suggested by John XXIII for the Second Vatican Council, is not without problems. At that time the questions were caused by the fact that a “pastoral” character was placed in the role of paradigm of council works, which was unusual to it according to the dominant ecclesiastic mentality. Bewilderment and expectations moved normalization will and renewal intents. The article retraces the remarkable passages of the dispute which took place during the council and after it in the sign of “pastoral nature” to be honored. The unavailability of an adequate and shared thematization of the term “pastoral” is its stamp. During our final comments pastoral theology is suggested as a character of a pertinent and proper thought to reflect correctly and substantially about the “pastoral” theme.

Author: Wénin, André
Title: Il serpente genesiaco (Gen 3,1-7) Interesse dell’analisi narrativa per una lettura teologica dell’Antico Testamento
Abstract Note: In the last thirty years narratology has been employed in the exegesis of narrative texts of the Bible. Starting from a narrative study of the ‘temptation’ scene (Gn 3,1-7), reading it in the light of the divine order in 2,16-17, the article attempts to show how this exegetical approach allows hermeneutical and theological elaboration of the narrative elements that such a method allows to observe. Thus another kind of biblical theology is brought to light: not a history of theological ideas of ancient Israel, but a theology processing the biblical narratives from the inside, in the hope of exercising the reader too.

Author: Biffi, Inos
Title: Figure medioevali della teologia: la teologia come "distrazione" della fede in san Bonaventura
Abstract Note: With the aim of reconstructing theology's figure according to saint Bonaventure, this study begins the analysis of the first and main work of the Franciscan Doctor, namely the Proem and the Commentary on the Sentences (o/ Peter Lombard). It is understoods as a transition from mere credibile - that is object of faith - to the intelligibile of the same credibile: this is an intelligibile, that does not abandon faith, nay, that is constructed by ascending in it /rom a ratio, which is endowed with the gifts of the Holy Spirit, particularly intellect, and yet is not coincident with faith, bus «dis-tracted» in respect of it and attracted to other requirements. The issue is the singularity of the epistemologica! species of theology, that is subjected at the same time to the necessity not to get out of faith and of its own contents, and to the necessity of an intelligibility, in wich ratio may be an essential component. At the conclusion of the whole research, the questions raised by this theology's figure in saint Bonaventure shall be pointed out, but already the course of this first analysis puts some interrogatives on the consistency and possibility of this knowledge: these interrogatives are bound to be sharpened and put in form of real problems in correlation to the kind of culture and philosophy that the Seraphical Doctor afterwards submitted to a theoretical examination.

Author: Moioli, Giovanni
Title: L' Unzione dei malati: il problema teologico della sua natura
Abstract Note: Also after the relative liveliness of studies and researches wich, since 1948, has renewed the attention of theology, of the officia! teaching (Magistero) of the Church, of the science of pastora! care on the sacrament of the Unction of the sick, the question about its nature maintains its actuality. This article considers in a critical manner several patterns wich interpret the nature of this sacrament as consummativum paenitentiae; as consecratio mortis; as sacrament of the sick; as expression of the Church, inasmuch as it is primordial sacrament. The Author concludes by offering, in his turn, a pattern of dealing with the task of understanding the nature of this sacrament: bere he puts in relief that, howerer, the question is the one of an obedience of the Church to Christ's purpose, and therefore it is shown that the understanding of this sacrament is not to be attained only by anthropological means.

Author: Randellini, Lino
Title: Bultmann in Italia (II)
Abstract Note: In this second part of his review of the Italian literature about Rudolf Bultmann, the Author considers the contributions afforded by B. Gherardini, G.B. Mondin, F. Donadio, and, in a wider manner, by I. Mancini; in reality, the last is the author who has dealt in the largest and most profound way with the crucial problems in Bultmann's theology. In is conclusive refiections, the Author sketches a final balance of his review, pointing out that in the discussion in Italy the critica! voices against Bultmann are prevailing; on his turn, the underlines, nothwithstanding, the undeniable merits of the theologian of Marburg, especially regarding the themes of de-mondanization and hermeneutics.

Author: Sequeri, Pierangelo
Title: L'immagine della teologia secondo la filosofia della religione. Nota retrospettiva in occasione del Novecento teologico di I. Mancini
Abstract Note: Theology's image according to religion's philosophy - Retrospective remarks in occasion of Novecento teologico by I. Mancini With reference to the recent publication of Novecento teologico by I. Mancini, the most genera[ issue of the image of «theology» correlative to a definition of «religion's philosophy» as the one propounded by this author is here examined. Por this aim, above alle the theses proposed by Mancini are concisely stated: the understands religion's philosophy as the epistemology of theological object (kérygma) and of its acknowledgement as truth, while theology in itself is understood as the «dogmatics» of that object, viz. the identification of its contents from the ecclesiastical-confessional point of view of orthodoxy and heresy. The theoretical structure of this distinction, and especially the conception of theology that stands under this setting, are pointed out as questionable just in connexion with the main-and shared, too—purpose of the research of Mancini: that is, to provide the theological understanding of faith, as «knowing» on truth, with a structure.
